segment.source: App inventory management for Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)
segment.target: App inventory management for Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can manage all apps that you've acquired on your Inventory page.
segment.target: You can manage all apps that you've acquired on your Inventory page.

segment.source: App inventory management for Windows Store for Business
segment.target: App inventory management for Windows Store for Business

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: You can manage all apps that you've acquired on your Inventory page.
segment.target: You can manage all apps that you've acquired on your Inventory page.

segment.source: The Inventory page in Windows Store for Business shows all apps in your inventory.
segment.target: The Inventory page in Windows Store for Business shows all apps in your inventory.

segment.source: This includes all apps that you've acquired from Store for Business, and the line-of-business (LOB) apps that you've accepted into your inventory.
segment.target: This includes all apps that you've acquired from Store for Business, and the line-of-business (LOB) apps that you've accepted into your inventory.

segment.source: After LOB apps are submitted to your organization, you'll see a notification on your Inventory page.
segment.target: After LOB apps are submitted to your organization, you'll see a notification on your Inventory page.

segment.source: On the New line-of-business apps page, you can accept, or reject the LOB apps.
segment.target: On the New line-of-business apps page, you can accept, or reject the LOB apps.

segment.source: For more information on LOB apps, see Working with line-of-business apps.
segment.target: For more information on LOB apps, see Working with line-of-business apps.

segment.source: All of these apps are treated the same once they are in your inventory and you can perform app lifecycle tasks for them: distribute apps, add apps to private store, review license details, and reclaim app licenses.
segment.target: All of these apps are treated the same once they are in your inventory and you can perform app lifecycle tasks for them: distribute apps, add apps to private store, review license details, and reclaim app licenses.

segment.source: Store for Business shows this info for each app in your inventory:
segment.target: Store for Business shows this info for each app in your inventory:

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Access to actions for the app
segment.target: Access to actions for the app

segment.source: Last modified date
segment.target: Last modified date

segment.source: Supported devices
segment.target: Supported devices

segment.source: Private store status
segment.target: Private store status

segment.source: Find apps in your inventory
segment.target: Find apps in your inventory

segment.source: There are a couple of ways to find specific apps, or groups of apps in your inventory.
segment.target: There are a couple of ways to find specific apps, or groups of apps in your inventory.

segment.source: Search - Use the Search box to search for an app.
segment.target: Search - Use the Search box to search for an app.

segment.source: Refine - Use Refine to scope your list of apps by one or more of these app attributes:
segment.target: Refine - Use Refine to scope your list of apps by one or more of these app attributes:

segment.source: License - Online or offline licenses.
segment.target: License - Online or offline licenses.

segment.source: For more info, see Apps in Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: For more info, see Apps in Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Platforms - Lists the devices that apps in your inventory were originally written to support.
segment.target: Platforms - Lists the devices that apps in your inventory were originally written to support.

segment.source: This list is cumulative for all apps in your inventory.
segment.target: This list is cumulative for all apps in your inventory.

segment.source:
Source
Store, for apps acquired from Store for Business, or LOB, for line-of-business apps.
segment.target:
Source
Store, for apps acquired from Store for Business, or LOB, for line-of-business apps.

segment.source:
Private store
In private store, or Not in private store, depending on whether or not you've added the app to your private store.
segment.target:
Private store
In private store, or Not in private store, depending on whether or not you've added the app to your private store.

segment.source: Manage apps in your inventory
segment.target: Manage apps in your inventory

segment.source: Each app in the Store for Business has an online, or an offline license.
segment.target: Each app in the Store for Business has an online, or an offline license.

segment.source: For more information on Store for Business licensing model, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: For more information on Store for Business licensing model, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: There are different actions you can take depending on the app license type.
segment.target: There are different actions you can take depending on the app license type.

segment.source: They're summarized in this table.
segment.target: They're summarized in this table.

segment.source: Action
segment.target: Action

segment.source: Online-licensed app
segment.target: Online-licensed app

segment.source: Offline-licensed app
segment.target: Offline-licensed app

segment.source: Assign to employees
segment.target: Assign to employees

segment.source: X
segment.target: X

segment.source: Add to private store
segment.target: Add to private store

segment.source: X
segment.target: X

segment.source: Remove from private store
segment.target: Remove from private store

segment.source: X
segment.target: X

segment.source: View license details
segment.target: View license details

segment.source: X
segment.target: X

segment.source: View product details
segment.target: View product details

segment.source: X
segment.target: X

segment.source: X
segment.target: X

segment.source: Download for offline use
segment.target: Download for offline use

segment.source: X
segment.target: X

segment.source: The actions in the table are how you distribute apps, and manage app licenses.
segment.target: The actions in the table are how you distribute apps, and manage app licenses.

segment.source: We'll cover those in the next sections.
segment.target: We'll cover those in the next sections.

segment.source: Working with offline-licensed apps has different steps.
segment.target: Working with offline-licensed apps has different steps.

segment.source: For more information on distributing offline-licensed apps, see Distribute offline apps.
segment.target: For more information on distributing offline-licensed apps, see Distribute offline apps.

segment.source: Distribute apps
segment.target: Distribute apps

segment.source: For online-licensed apps, there are a couple of ways to distribute apps from your inventory:
segment.target: For online-licensed apps, there are a couple of ways to distribute apps from your inventory:

segment.source: Assign apps to people in your organization.
segment.target: Assign apps to people in your organization.

segment.source: Add apps to your private store, and let people in your organization install the app.
segment.target: Add apps to your private store, and let people in your organization install the app.

segment.source: If you use a management tool that supports Store for Business, you can distribute apps with your management tool.
segment.target: If you use a management tool that supports Store for Business, you can distribute apps with your management tool.

segment.source: Once it is configured to work with Store for Business, your managment tool will have access to all apps in your inventory.
segment.target: Once it is configured to work with Store for Business, your managment tool will have access to all apps in your inventory.

segment.source: For more information, see Distribute apps with a management tool.
segment.target: For more information, see Distribute apps with a management tool.

segment.source: Once an app is in your private store, people in your org can install the app on their devices.
segment.target: Once an app is in your private store, people in your org can install the app on their devices.

segment.source: For more information, see Distribute apps using your private store.
segment.target: For more information, see Distribute apps using your private store.

segment.source: To make an app in inventory available in your private store
segment.target: To make an app in inventory available in your private store

segment.source: Sign in to the Store for Business.
segment.target: Sign in to the Store for Business.

segment.source: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.
segment.target: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.

segment.source: Click Refine, and then choose Online.
segment.target: Click Refine, and then choose Online.

segment.source: Store for Business will update the list of apps on the Inventory page.
segment.target: Store for Business will update the list of apps on the Inventory page.

segment.source: From an app in Inventory, click the ellipses under Action, and then choose Add to private store.
segment.target: From an app in Inventory, click the ellipses under Action, and then choose Add to private store.

segment.source: The value under Private store for the app will change to pending.
segment.target: The value under Private store for the app will change to pending.

segment.source: It will take approximately twelve hours before the app is available in the private store.
segment.target: It will take approximately twelve hours before the app is available in the private store.

segment.source: Employees can claim apps that admins added to the private store by doing the following.
segment.target: Employees can claim apps that admins added to the private store by doing the following.

segment.source: To claim an app from the private store
segment.target: To claim an app from the private store

segment.source: Sign in to your computer with your Azure Active Directory (AD) credentials, and start the Windows Store app.
segment.target: Sign in to your computer with your Azure Active Directory (AD) credentials, and start the Windows Store app.

segment.source: Click the private store tab.
segment.target: Click the private store tab.

segment.source: Click the app you want to install, and then click Install.
segment.target: Click the app you want to install, and then click Install.

segment.source: Another way to distribute apps is by assigning them to people in your organization.
segment.target: Another way to distribute apps is by assigning them to people in your organization.

segment.source: If you decide that you don't want an app available for employees to install on their own, you can remove it from your private store.
segment.target: If you decide that you don't want an app available for employees to install on their own, you can remove it from your private store.

segment.source: To remove an app from the private store
segment.target: To remove an app from the private store

segment.source: Sign in to the Store for Business.
segment.target: Sign in to the Store for Business.

segment.source: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.
segment.target: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.

segment.source: Find an app, click the ellipses under Action, and then choose Remove from private store, and then click Remove.
segment.target: Find an app, click the ellipses under Action, and then choose Remove from private store, and then click Remove.

segment.source: The app will still be in your inventory, but your employees will not have access to the app from your private store.
segment.target: The app will still be in your inventory, but your employees will not have access to the app from your private store.

segment.source: To assign an app to an employee
segment.target: To assign an app to an employee

segment.source: Sign in to the Store for Business.
segment.target: Sign in to the Store for Business.

segment.source: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.
segment.target: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.

segment.source: Find an app, click the ellipses under Action, and then choose Assign to people.
segment.target: Find an app, click the ellipses under Action, and then choose Assign to people.

segment.source: Type the email address for the employee that you're assigning the app to, and click Confirm.
segment.target: Type the email address for the employee that you're assigning the app to, and click Confirm.

segment.source: Employees will receive an email with a link that will install the app on their device.
segment.target: Employees will receive an email with a link that will install the app on their device.

segment.source: Click the link to start the Windows Store app, and then click Install.
segment.target: Click the link to start the Windows Store app, and then click Install.

segment.source: Also, in the Windows Store app, they can find the app under My Library.
segment.target: Also, in the Windows Store app, they can find the app under My Library.

segment.source: Manage app licenses
segment.target: Manage app licenses

segment.source: For each app in your inventory, you can view and manage license details.
segment.target: For each app in your inventory, you can view and manage license details.

segment.source: This give you another way to assign apps to people in your organization.
segment.target: This give you another way to assign apps to people in your organization.

segment.source: It also allows you to reclaim app licenses after they've been assigned to people, or claimed by people in your organization.
segment.target: It also allows you to reclaim app licenses after they've been assigned to people, or claimed by people in your organization.

segment.source: To view license details
segment.target: To view license details

segment.source: Sign in to Store for Business
segment.target: Sign in to Store for Business

segment.source: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.
segment.target: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.

segment.source: Click the ellipses for and app, and then choose View license details.
segment.target: Click the ellipses for and app, and then choose View license details.

segment.source: You'll see the names of people in your organization who have installed the app and are using one of the licenses.
segment.target: You'll see the names of people in your organization who have installed the app and are using one of the licenses.

segment.source: On Assigned licenses, you can do several things:
segment.target: On Assigned licenses, you can do several things:

segment.source: Assign the app to other people in your organization.
segment.target: Assign the app to other people in your organization.

segment.source: Reclaim app licenses.
segment.target: Reclaim app licenses.

segment.source: View app details.
segment.target: View app details.

segment.source: Add the app to your private store, if it is not in the private store.
segment.target: Add the app to your private store, if it is not in the private store.

segment.source: You can assign the app to more people in your organization, or reclaim licenses.
segment.target: You can assign the app to more people in your organization, or reclaim licenses.

segment.source: To assign an app to more people
segment.target: To assign an app to more people

segment.source: Click Assign to people, type the email address for the employee that you're assigning the app to, and click Assign.
segment.target: Click Assign to people, type the email address for the employee that you're assigning the app to, and click Assign.

segment.source: Store for Business updates the list of assigned licenses.
segment.target: Store for Business updates the list of assigned licenses.

segment.source: To reclaim licenses
segment.target: To reclaim licenses

segment.source: Choose the person you want to reclaim the license from, click Reclaim licenses, and then click Reclaim licenses.
segment.target: Choose the person you want to reclaim the license from, click Reclaim licenses, and then click Reclaim licenses.

segment.source: Store for Business updates the list of assigned licenses.
segment.target: Store for Business updates the list of assigned licenses.

segment.source: Download offline-licensed app
segment.target: Download offline-licensed app

segment.source: Offline licensing is a new feature in Windows 10 and allows apps to be deployed to devices that are not connected to the Internet.
segment.target: Offline licensing is a new feature in Windows 10 and allows apps to be deployed to devices that are not connected to the Internet.

segment.source: This means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.
segment.target: This means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.

segment.source: You can download offline-licensed apps from your inventory.
segment.target: You can download offline-licensed apps from your inventory.

segment.source: You'll need to download these items:
segment.target: You'll need to download these items:

segment.source: App metadata
segment.target: App metadata

segment.source: App package
segment.target: App package

segment.source: App license
segment.target: App license

segment.source: App framework
segment.target: App framework

segment.source: For more information about online and offline licenses, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: For more information about online and offline licenses, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: For more information about downloading offline-licensed apps, see Download offline apps.
segment.target: For more information about downloading offline-licensed apps, see Download offline apps.
